@malpern @adamnash Point me to the proof
4/ Proving P = NP, therefore may be equivalent to proving entropy can be reversed, hence a cyclic universe.
3/ 1-way functions, like multiplication of primes, cannot easily be reversed, exactly as all reactions increase entropy.
2/ If P != NP, the universe may still be cyclic, but cycle length ~= num of possible particle x location combinations http://t.co/sLugWv0AtE
If P = NP, one way functions do not exist and ultimately the universe is cyclical.  If P != NP, then time an history are purely linear.
